intro: Heliocarpus diclinus, commonly known as the variable sycamore, is a deciduous tree native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its bipinnate leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The tree produces woody, indehiscent fruits that are typically covered in a thick, leathery coating. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
